description.narrative: The group will analyze the potential impacts of construction along the Logone River. Flooding in the far north region of Cameroon (Yaere) has become annual occurrence, and in 2012 the flooding was so severe, killing dozens of people and displacing thousands, national and international groups organized to provide emergency relief. To curb future flooding, the government and foreign investment bodies (potentially the Islamic Development Bank and Saudi Arabia government) have shown interest in constructing dykes along the river. However, despite flooding, areas in the region are chronically dry because of construction from the Maga dam for rice irrigation and dykes could worsen the situation. The group hopes to investigate the sources of funding for the dyke construction, perform environmental impact assessment, and inform the public of the results.
